main event: An observer reported seeing a glowing reddish-orange object in Raleigh, North Carolina on May 26, 1966.
interesting points: The object was compared in brightness to a welding torch.,The observer described the object as solid and circular in shape.,The object emitted a high-pitched whirring sound like a generator., It moved faster than a normal aircraft and disappeared rapidly from sight.,The observer had experience with aircraft and was reluctant to report the sighting due to concerns about credibility.
witness description: The main observer is a 57-year-old male Air Force Instructor Pilot who has had numerous sightings of similar objects.
